page.title: 01Farmlands Around Scamridge
page.content: A plateau mainly farmland and coniferous forest. Deep valleys caused by forestry commision from 1920. Plder crops nmow being felled. Replanting with conifers and sprinkling of broad leaved species. Mixed farming. Mainly sheep and Stope Cattle onr or two big farms have large milking herds. Quite a few signs of medieval occupation - Tumuli and earthworks. The vary popular Troutdale scenic road bisects the block. Givendale head farm largest milking herd in block (Frisians). Lot machinery used on large cultivated fields.
